Joseph's Portfolio

Faria Systems

  1. OpenApply

    Demo URL: https://demo.openapply.com/admin/forms/9/edit

    Product Description

    School can design their applicant forms in a very flexible way. Both parents and students can apply on internet without any paper. It's the most powerful form builder I ever know.

    What I Have Done

    • Form Editor: You can create all kinds of fields, make group, and drag'n'drop it.

  2. Keybridge

    Demo URL: Not ready yet. Only the portal site for general users.

    Product Description

    The integrated CRM which is based on Xero accounting system.

    What I Have Done

    • Dashboard: Use InfiniteScroll to load actvitiy feed.
    • Billing: I help to integrate the Stripe JS API.
    • Tasks: A convenient UI for Sales to manage their tasks. I make everything except model.

  3. Bootstrap Keybridge

    Demo URL: http://sample.keyb.com/ (Documentation on Github)

    Product Description

    We need to unify UI styles and reuse the icons and JS componentsin every future projects. So I decide to create a Ruby gem which facilitates my F2Es to make the prototypes.

    Here are the components I've created. Bar, Button, Font Sizes, Grids, Label Drop, Table, Cascade, Checkall, Date Input, Dropform, Fancy Select, Form Validate, Image Preview, Notification, Price Input, Slider

  4. iSIS

    Demo URL: Not ready yet. Only the portal site for general users.

    Product Description

    Keybridge for IB schools. Also a centeralized system which integrates Faria's two services.

    What I Have Done

    Responsible for unify the UI for all the systems. Plan and assign resource to deliever production-level prototypes. Made HTML prototype in lightning speed.

D-Link (miiiCasa)

  • Goodie Bar

    Demo URL: Project Failed

    Product Description

    If you have a miiiCasa-enabled router, you can have this bar showing on every web page you visited.

    What I Have Done

    It's all done by me. And I have to design API interface which I need from Router. The most challenge part is not browser compatibility issue but websites compatbility issue. I need to make this bar work correctly on all the major web sites.

  • Music Player

    Demo URL: http://miiicasa.com/s/371l

    What I Have Done

    This Music Player can play all major audio formats in user's storage. I create it based on SoundManager2 and YUI event system.

  • Photo Viewer

    Demo URL: http://miiicasa.com/s/3f8d

    What I Have Done

    miiiCasa also need to have a Photo Viewer which is very similar with Facebook's. I create it based on YUI Apps. It's actually a YUI version of Backbone.js. It's my first successful JavaScript MVC project.

Yahoo!

  • Movie

    Demo URL: http://tw.movie.yahoo.com

    Product Description

    Shows recently movie information and tv schedule.

    What I Have Done

    • Global: I create the HTML prototypes and JavaScript with another F2E.
    • TV Schedule: The first rich JavaScript application I've made. It uses huge amount of AJAX at that years. Please check this URL.

  • Answer

    Demo URL: http://tw.knowledge.yahoo.com (Style Changed, but my JS/HTML is still there.)

    Product Description

    Yahoo! Answer in Taiwan

    What I Have Done

    • Global: Everything. I create all the HTML/CSS/JS prototypes by myself and co-work with back-end engineers.
    • Tagging List: The most complicated page in this project. I am the first one who really implement Browser Histroy Management in Yahoo! Taiwan.
    • CSS/JS Auto Compression Mechanism: I am not just limited in Front-End. Also write a PHP script which can concat JS/CSS files according to different pages automatically. whih is very good for performance.

  • Yahoo! Developer Network

    Demo URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20120317074116/http://tw.developer.yahoo.com/

    What I Have Done

    As a Yahoo! Technology Evangelist, I create this site, write blogs, and keep connection with developer communities all by myself.
